Review Text:
I was amazed at the transformation of Khadi store. In the '80s the only store that I knew existed was in Pookadai. I used to buy honey in thick glass bottles(not presentable). There was then a reputation that Khadi honey is pure and harvested from farmers. In the next years, after the '90s, I could not buy from Khadi as I live in Singapore. However in my recent trip last week, after trying many different brands of honey, I decided to buy again from Khadi hoping that they live up to the past reputation of selling pure honey.
I was amazed that they had such a vast variety of products, and homegrown groceries too!
I wish them success and hope they continue to expand nearer to the consumer.

Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM
Review Text:
Good government showroom placed exactly on the main road Anna salai. I have visited their self service  Supermarket. Great quality products starting from organic snacks to provisional items to soaps to Nilgiris ucliptus tea  , natural honey, oththukuli ghee..wow lots of great quality products & varities which we can't miss out. Majority doesn't know this place because of show room appeal. Show room looks like 19th century place. Not sure why nobody putting effort to improve this aesthetically.
Coming to billing, typical government staffs & demotivated employees. Only one counter and there is a big queue. After billing, you have to step out for cashier (luckily , fortunately, they are accepting cards) then you have to show the slip to delivery counter to collect your items.
They could have brought several items into Online selling to avoid this crowd. Also, they should provide contactless payment like UPI bar code etc which is now a days street side vendor is doing..
Very importantly, govt should encourage all employees to buy home stuffs from here by providing coupons, gift card etc. This way, all these kadhi bhavan can become more profitable and make touch completion against all private players.
Most importantly, put young energetic staffs atleast in Supermarket/cashier section to appease customers. Current staffs still think they are the customers and we are the devotees . This attitude should change.
Considering the product quality & supporting our  own farmers & weavers , request to purchase here more often though we have above constraints..

Review Text: I had an outstanding experience at the Khaadi store in Dubai Mall, thanks to an exceptional staff member, either named Bony or Johny. Unlike past visits, where I found the staff a bit reluctant to help, this young African gentleman was incredibly welcoming and knowledgeable. Despite being from a different culture (I believe he might be from Kenya), he spoke passionately about the brand and suggested items I hadnâ€™t initially considered. His enthusiasm and friendliness made my shopping experience truly enjoyable. I even spoke to the manager, Mohammad, to commend him. Khaadi is lucky to have such a dedicated employee â€“ he made my visit unforgettable!

Review Text:
I recently visited the Khaadi store at Dubai Mall with my wife for an exchange and to purchase some new items. We were assisted by a male staff member wearing a peach shirt and glasses, who appeared to be of Indian or Pakistani descent. His service was exceptional he went above and beyond our expectations, helping us find the right sizes and staying with us throughout our shopping journey.
We are regular customers at one of your Deira stores, but we have never experienced such outstanding service before. The level of attention and care we received was truly remarkable. Although there are only five stars available, I would give this store seven stars for customer service if I could. We look forward to returning to Dubai Mall Khaadi for future shopping trips.
Thank you for providing such a great experience!

Review Text:
I went to a few shops looking for good hiking shoes and as nothing matched my needs, I was advised to visit Camper's Corner. What an incredible place. Lam may have changed my life with making me realize i've been using wrong sized hiking shoes for years! We spent a good hour, and despite my resistance, him and few others patiently worked with me to make the right choice. Same for the others that helped me chose the right fit pants, and to top it all off, the super welcoming owner Kelvin rounded off the experience with a chilled beer, great conversation and sharing of experiences with another cool older couple that had ended up in this lovely shop the same as I did.
This is how experiences should be. We love the outdoors and sharing experiences with like minded people. To find such a vibe in Singapore was the perfect ending before I left the country.

Thank you all at Campers Corner.

Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Review Text:
Phone â€“ Fold 3

The protector costs $75.90 for a phablet.

Bought and applied on 28 July 2022 (Thursday). Entire process is around an hour. Due to the application issues, there was a scratch on the screen protector. Resend on 29 July 2022 (Friday) for re-application. The entire process took over an hour.

During the second application, the staff handed back the phone to me for check, for which I assumed that the job was completed. After seeing some poor finishing, he than mentioned he was just showing me the phone to check. I was like â€œcheck whatâ€ if it was not completed. Why donâ€™t you complete the job before letting me check the finishing?

After the second completion, still not satisfied with the application, I asked him if this was how the product is supposed to look after it is completed. He mentioned yes. After debating for a few rounds, he told me to go and write a Google review if I am still not satisfied. I was like wow, great way to speak to your customers. I said thank you and left. For clarity, I left because the staff told me that the application of the screen protector is as good as it gets so.

For your information, pictures were taken on 30 July 2022 (1 day after application). I let the pictures do the talking, cause for the price, expected the finishing to be much better. If this was $10 or $20, I can close one eye. But $75.90 for a screen protector is pricey and IMO, I expected a lot more.

Also, these pictures were taken one day after, so you can imagine how well the protectors hold.

I do see their staff genuinely trying to help, doing their best to rectify the issues, could have been a tad bit more apologetic though. But fundamentally speaking, I think that there is a product flaw as the protector does not apply smoothly across all the surfaces. This could be due to the phone curves edge but in this case, donâ€™t sell for this model. If you are going to charge $75.90, the customer is going to expect more for the product.

The $10 lifetime warranty is not useful too. If the product is fundamentally flawed, no point giving lifetime warranty as it does not solve the product issue in the first place.

Your phone is also going to be very hot after application as they use a heat dryer for application.

Overall, not too great an experience, but guess this is as good as it is going to get. Almost 3 hours and $75.90 loss, let my loss be your gain. Customer service also does not make up for the entire experience. Skip the product, just go somewhere else.

2 out of 5 starts and do not recommend.

Above represents my own opinion only.

Review Text:
I'll let the photo do most of the talking. I'm not sure if it's a product or skill issue. I paid 75 for a fusion screen protector for my iPad Pro, and waited for almost an hour, with 2 attempts made to apply the film on my device.

When it was done, I asked if the wipe marks would go off. The person said yes, in a few hours, which I thought was fine and not uncommon anyway. And, I walked around the mall, went for my lunch and during my lunch, whipped out my iPad to see what was shown in the photo. It's not even wipe marks anymore, just bubbles. I mean, even film on my Samsung phone from other shop isn't of this quality.

This was when out of curiosity, I googled and read many of the similar poor reviews. I didn't even bother with the lifetime warranty anymore because I thought this film wasn't suitable for scribbling with an apple pencil too. So, I went ahead to iStudio on the 2nd level to change to tempered glass. That's of course, another hefty sum, but at least, worth spending as compared to this.

Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Review Text:
Got their 360 degree protection at 15 Feb 2023 which cost $129.90 (they consider my phone as phablet, so it is more expensive than usual phone), in less than 3 months of usage as you can see in the picture, the side and bottom protector started to fall off, even the front and back cover is collecting plenty amount of dusts at the edges.

And most importantly I noticed the protector itself is very sensitive to water, there is once my hand is slightly watery due to rain and one of the corner of the protector just fall off immediately after I touches my phone. At the end I have to 'repair' them myself by slowly pushing it back. So theoretically now my phone is splashproof, but my phone protector is not, lol. And they never mentioned this when I purchase at their counter

According to their life time warranty policy, I will have to pay $10 each time if I need to go back and ask them to readjust the protector. As a consumer I don't think it worth the money consider I only used it for less than 3 months.

Overall I think it is a good solution, the material is really good and tough like they declared, just it has some problems to resolve before you can put it into daily usage,

1. The protector is so easy to fall off from the edges since your hand touches it everyday
2. It is too sensitive to water

Hope they can come out something that can resolve the 2 issues mentioned above, and before that, I think you should consider other protector option in the market

Space was spacious. Equipment was well equipped. Staff are friendly but only one thing I am not happy with is their equipment.

Rental a studio from there few months back. Don't get cheated by their website. Their website indicated different type of backdrop that are available, but during the production itself, most of the backdrop can't be use. (its clients personal backdrop) ....

I wanted to use the thunder grey backdrop for my shoot, but they say can't be used as it client's backdrop. If I knew the thunder grey backdrop can't be used, I won't even book their studio.

Piece of advice: if the backdrop is not available and can't be used, please don't put it on your website. Call them before making your booking.

Review Text:
G-9 Outfitters, a factory outlet, struggles with a disorganized setup where clothes are stacked haphazardly. The store layout is not customer-friendly, and a notable downside is the presence of defective items. To counterbalance these issues, the outlet offers substantial discounts of up to 70% on select articles. Unfortunately, finding the right size becomes a challenge due to limited availability.
G-9 Outfitters seems to present a trade-off between affordability and quality, prompting customers to weigh the benefits of discounted prices against the inconveniences associated with the outlet's organizational shortcomings and product defects.

Review Text:
The Starbucks in Times Square is truly a standout location! Right in the heart of one of the most iconic spots in New York City, this store offers the perfect blend of energy and relaxation. Whether youâ€™re grabbing a quick coffee before exploring the city or taking a break to recharge, this Starbucks has you covered.

Despite the crowds, the atmosphere remains welcoming, and the service is always top-notch. Review Text:
This location is the best example of how much Starbucks has forgotten what made them well known worldwide. Nowadays it feels like beating in the cheapest McDonald's.

Their baristas are not well trained, their only goal is to make drinks as fast and effortless as possible. I ordered an Espresso frappuccino that looked practically white and tasted like plain syrup. When I told them something was off they told me they can charge me for another. They ended up doing it again without charge, but the same, I could see how they got a lot of leftovers which means they either over milked it or over iced it.

On top of that, the place is messy and dirty; I know that is in part the fault of tourists not being clean, but that also talked of an unwillingness to hire enough staff to keep things running right.

The atmosphere is off. The A/C at the highest, likes purposely trying to make it as less cozy as possible so you leave immediately. Long are the days where Sbux was a cozy inviting place with jazz music in the background.

For such an expensive coffee, I'm expecting nothing out of the ordinary; just the same quality they were known for

Review Text: I opened an app and saw a new drink that my husband wanted to try, so we went to the store to order it. The person at the register seemed confused and asked me to repeat the name of the drink five times. My husband ended up showing him the sign on top of the fridge with the drink's name and image, which he seemed to know nothing about. I guess that was a sign not to order, but it was our fault for still doing so. Since I don't drink caffeine, I ordered a regular decaf iced coffee with cream and sugar. I double-checked and asked if decaf was doable, and he said, yeah ofc. We ordered two drinks, which cost around $14. For two drinks? Insane, but that's the reality of this crazy economy. We waited, and when our drinks came out, we tasted them. My husband's drink was way too sweet, and mine tasted a little off. So, I asked the barista if my drink was decaf. He said no, as they only offer decaf espresso, not decaf iced coffee. So, why did he take the order and confirm he could do decaf iced coffee? We basically wasted $14. I didnâ€™t bother asking for a different drink and just walked out.

Review Text:
Today reminded me why I gave up Starbucks years ago and deleted their app from my phone. Yes your former physical named gold card holder. I might still have the card in my old wallet. Only reason I re-downloaded the app and decided to place an order today was because someone at work gifted me a Starbucks gift card.

Order placed 9:35am on the app as I'm walking into the store, a simple Venti Pike with half and half. For some reason, app tells me it'll be ready at 9:47am. No clue why it would take 12 mins but ok. Maybe the app is over-compensating and it'll be ready early. Nope.

9:47am hits. App tells me that my order's ready. The board in the shop tells me it is ready. But no coffee with my name appears. 9:53am, no coffee. Finally I manage to get an employee's attention. Maybe somebody else took my cup. No she tells me that her colleague is working on it. Well the app said it was ready 6 minutes ago. So someone's lying. Finally get my coffee at 9:56am.

21 minutes from order to pickup for a simple coffee that any local NYC deli would fill in 30 seconds. What is this company doing? How are they so horribly mismanaged?

And the worst part, I still have a balance of $20.70 left on the app.

Review Text:
I had high hopes for the Starbucks on Roosevelt Island, but unfortunately, my experience was quite disappointing. First off, the staff seemed uninterested and not very friendly. I understand everyone has off days, but it felt like they were just going through the motions rather than providing good customer service.

The order I placed took much longer than expected, and when I finally received my coffee, it was lukewarm at best. Itâ€™s hard to enjoy a drink when itâ€™s not even at the right temperature, and to make matters worse, the coffee was watered down and lacked flavor.

I also decided to grab a breakfast sandwich, and it was awful. The bread was soggy, the eggs tasted bland, and the overall sandwich had an unpleasant, stale taste. Itâ€™s safe to say it wasnâ€™t worth the price, and I couldnâ€™t even finish it.

The cleanliness of the store was also lacking. There were crumbs and spilled drinks on the counter, and the tables werenâ€™t wiped down properly. Iâ€™ve come to expect better from a Starbucks, but this location didnâ€™t live up to the usual standards.

All in all, it was a frustrating visit, and Iâ€™m unlikely to return anytime soon. There are other coffee options on Roosevelt Island that are far more welcoming and offer better quality beverages and food.

Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM
Review Text:
This location is the best example of how much Starbucks has forgotten what made them well known worldwide. Nowadays it feels like beating in the cheapest McDonald's.

Their baristas are not well trained, their only goal is to make drinks as fast and effortless as possible. I ordered an Espresso frappuccino that looked practically white and tasted like plain syrup. When I told them something was off they told me they can charge me for another. They ended up doing it again without charge, but the same, I could see how they got a lot of leftovers which means they either over milked it or over iced it.

On top of that, the place is messy and dirty; I know that is in part the fault of tourists not being clean, but that also talked of an unwillingness to hire enough staff to keep things running right.

The atmosphere is off. The A/C at the highest, likes purposely trying to make it as less cozy as possible so you leave immediately. Long are the days where Sbux was a cozy inviting place with jazz music in the background.

For such an expensive coffee, I'm expecting nothing out of the ordinary; just the same quality they were known for

Review Text: I opened an app and saw a new drink that my husband wanted to try, so we went to the store to order it. The person at the register seemed confused and asked me to repeat the name of the drink five times. My husband ended up showing him the sign on top of the fridge with the drink's name and image, which he seemed to know nothing about. I guess that was a sign not to order, but it was our fault for still doing so. Since I don't drink caffeine, I ordered a regular decaf iced coffee with cream and sugar. I double-checked and asked if decaf was doable, and he said, yeah ofc. We ordered two drinks, which cost around $14. For two drinks? Insane, but that's the reality of this crazy economy. We waited, and when our drinks came out, we tasted them. My husband's drink was way too sweet, and mine tasted a little off. So, I asked the barista if my drink was decaf. He said no, as they only offer decaf espresso, not decaf iced coffee. So, why did he take the order and confirm he could do decaf iced coffee? We basically wasted $14. I didnâ€™t bother asking for a different drink and just walked out.

Review Text:
Today reminded me why I gave up Starbucks years ago and deleted their app from my phone. Yes your former physical named gold card holder. I might still have the card in my old wallet. Only reason I re-downloaded the app and decided to place an order today was because someone at work gifted me a Starbucks gift card.

Order placed 9:35am on the app as I'm walking into the store, a simple Venti Pike with half and half. For some reason, app tells me it'll be ready at 9:47am. No clue why it would take 12 mins but ok. Maybe the app is over-compensating and it'll be ready early. Nope.

9:47am hits. App tells me that my order's ready. The board in the shop tells me it is ready. But no coffee with my name appears. 9:53am, no coffee. Finally I manage to get an employee's attention. Maybe somebody else took my cup. No she tells me that her colleague is working on it. Well the app said it was ready 6 minutes ago. So someone's lying. Finally get my coffee at 9:56am.

21 minutes from order to pickup for a simple coffee that any local NYC deli would fill in 30 seconds. What is this company doing? How are they so horribly mismanaged?

And the worst part, I still have a balance of $20.70 left on the app.

Overall, definitely worth a trip if you are in the area and need a refresher!

Review Text:
I had high hopes for the Starbucks on Roosevelt Island, but unfortunately, my experience was quite disappointing. First off, the staff seemed uninterested and not very friendly. I understand everyone has off days, but it felt like they were just going through the motions rather than providing good customer service.

The order I placed took much longer than expected, and when I finally received my coffee, it was lukewarm at best. Itâ€™s hard to enjoy a drink when itâ€™s not even at the right temperature, and to make matters worse, the coffee was watered down and lacked flavor.

I also decided to grab a breakfast sandwich, and it was awful. The bread was soggy, the eggs tasted bland, and the overall sandwich had an unpleasant, stale taste. Itâ€™s safe to say it wasnâ€™t worth the price, and I couldnâ€™t even finish it.

The cleanliness of the store was also lacking. There were crumbs and spilled drinks on the counter, and the tables werenâ€™t wiped down properly. Iâ€™ve come to expect better from a Starbucks, but this location didnâ€™t live up to the usual standards.

All in all, it was a frustrating visit, and Iâ€™m unlikely to return anytime soon. There are other coffee options on Roosevelt Island that are far more welcoming and offer better quality beverages and food.
